added.title: Added a 'Favorite Layout' feature (issue #94)
added.subtitle: This is an alternative to the default Edge Tiling. It adapts the keyboard shortcuts and allows you to drag windows to a predefined layout. Checkout the User Guide for details

added.title: Added an in-app Changelog dialog
added.subtitle: On each new release of this extension the Changelog opens when you open the preference window. You can disable this behaviour in the Hidden Settings

removed.title: Removed the Tile Editing Mode's focus color
removed.subtitle: The previous setting was only meant as a workaround. Now we can always follow the system's native Tile-Preview style

changed.title: Changed the behaviour of Tile to top and Toggle Maximization under certain circumstances (discussion #107)
changed.subtitle: These keyboard shortcuts now always cycle between each other when using the dynamic keybinding behaviours Tiling State or Tiling State (Windows)

changed.title: Turned the setting Tiling Popup: Current Workspace only into Include apps from all workspaces and moved it to the general settings page
changed.subtitle: Since GNOME's native app switcher exposes this setting now, follow suit

changed.title: Moved the Inverse Top Screen Edge Action settings to the Hidden Settings
changed.subtitle: This is probably too niche for the general settings

changed.title: Reworked the preference window to follow GNOME's design more closely
